intro: Dimeria ornithopoda var. nana, commonly known as the dwarf desert daisy, is a succulent plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows close to the ground, with small, erect stems and clustered, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are thick and ribbed, adapted to store water and reduce transpiration in dry conditions. This variety is distinguished by its compact size and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
